Welcome to Lesson 3: Numbers in German (Zahlen).

In German, we can learn millions of numbers by learning only 17 German words

Here are the first 13 of the 17

Numbers from 0 to 10 in German: 0 = null 1 = eins 2 = zwei 3 = drei 4 = vier 5 = fÃ¼nf 6 = sechs 7 = sieben 8 = acht 9 = neun 10 = zehn 11 = elf 12 = zwolf

Numbers from 13 to 19 We will only add Zehn which means 10 to the number. The number at ones place comes first and then the tens place.
For Example : Thirteen is written as drei (3) + zehn (10) 13 = dreizehn 14 = vierzehn 15 = fÃ¼nfzehn 16 = sechzehn (notice minor change, this is just to make the word sound more appropriate) 17 = siebzehn (notice minor change, this is just to make the word sound more appropriate) 18 = achtzehn 19 = neunzehn

20 (14th of the 17) and the Numbers in multiples of 10
20= zwonzig
All numbers in multiples of 10 in German only add Zig at the end
30 = drei+zig = dreizig
40 = vierzig
50 = fÃ¼nfzig
60 = sechzig (notice difference)
70 = siebzig (notice difference)
80 = achtzig
90 = neunzig

Numbers like 21, 22 and so on..
For numbers 21-29 or 31-39 and so on we write the number at ones place with 20 or 30 and so on
For Example :
21 = eins (1) + und + zwonzig (20) = einundzwonzig
22= zweiundzwanzig
34 = vierunddreizig
77 = siebenundsiebzig
86 = sechsundachtzig

The remanining 3 of 17 are 100, 1000 and 10,00,000 :
100 = hundert
1000 = tausend
10,00,000 = million
